a.title: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement). This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

a.title: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

short.value: Allergy intolerance model

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for allergy/intolerance

short.value: Basic metadata for this information

definition.value: Basic metadata for this information

short.value: Patient/subject information

definition.value: Patient/subject information

short.value: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

definition.value: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

short.value: The author of the allergy/intolerance information.

definition.value: The author of the allergy/intolerance information.

short.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

definition.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

definition.value: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement). This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

definition.value: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

short.value: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).

definition.value: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).

requirements.value: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL. Cardinality in MyHealth@EU for this element, used here, is one manifestation per severity and onset, while the cardinality in FHIR IPS IG allows multiple manifestations per severity and onset.

short.value: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

definition.value: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

short.value: Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and /or clinical evidence of condition

definition.value: Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and /or clinical evidence of condition

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

short.value: When allergy or intolerance was identified

definition.value: When allergy or intolerance was identified

requirements.value: MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

short.value: Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)

definition.value: Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)

requirements.value: eHN PS Guideline, MyHealth@EU, ISO IPS

short.value: Adverse reaction events linked to exposure to substance.

definition.value: Adverse reaction events linked to exposure to substance.

requirements.value: ISO IPS (explicit), implicitly in eHN PS Guideline, MH@EU

short.value: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event

definition.value: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

short.value: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).

definition.value: Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema. (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction).

requirements.value: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL. Cardinality in MyHealth@EU for this element, used here, is one manifestation per severity and onset, while the cardinality in FHIR IPS IG allows multiple manifestations per severity and onset.

short.value: Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.

definition.value: Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.

requirements.value: The element is present in eHN PS GL, MyHealth@EU specifications and ISO IPS. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.

description.value: SNOMED CT, HL7 reaction event severity

short.value: Date and time of the onset of the reaction

definition.value: Date and time of the onset of the reaction

requirements.value: The element is present in eHN PS GL. Element name and description is taken from eHN PS GL.
